ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My writing skills improved ten-fold and I really learned how to construct a story with stronger dialogue and characters. I also learned how to better revise my own work and give feedback to others regarding theirs.
How to write shrot story, narative poem, list poem, sonnets, and one-act play; techniques for effective writing; how to build character and story
Creative writing skills for poetry, drama, and fiction, as well as a general knowledge of writing styles and tips

I have learned so much about how to improve my writing through this course. Through each unit (short stories, poetry, and drama), I saw my writing improve and learned more about the technical structures of each craft. This course allowed me to explore creative writing and to really delve into how to improve and rewrite stories effectively.
By taking this course, I discovered new ways to develop ideas, begin stories, and revise my writing.
I gained a greater understanding of the art of creative writing, as well as how to better manufacture fiction at my own will, as opposed to whenever the whim arises.
How to make story flow from one to the next, how to not write "on-the-nose" writing, techniques for how to best begin writing, SO MUCH!
So much, this course taught me how to be a better writer.
I learned so much about creative writing!
How to write fiction, drama, and poetry.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: I thought the structure was especially conducive to being a better writer (reading and discussing professional pieces then workshopping our own pieces). The topics discussed also were extremely relevant for constructing good writing, and the plenary lectures were also fantastic. The readings were amazing and none of them were ever boring.

Weaknesses: None for the course, but I wish we had more time to delve into each style more.

Strengths: the freedom and laid-back style of the class, the readings were entertaining, the assignments were to not too much
Weaknesses: grading creative writing can be very degrading, especially if the pieces are vulnerable
This class was absolutely fantastic. The course was fun and constructive. The grading for this class provided a lot of feedback but low stress. This class had no weaknesses in my opinion.

This class was great in fostering a sense of community in workshops, the level and depth of feedback, and the overall dissection of creative writing to become more accessible to the beginning writer. I would say it could be more organized, but this never affected anyone negatively.
Sometimes the deadlines were announced a little late, but Prof Green was also very open and understanding about extensions!
I think that the way Green teaches this course is great as is. If anything it should be made more accessible to students who wish to take creative writing.
I love how diverse the course was and how supporting the course environment was. I think it could have been helpful to have less last-minute deadlines.

A strength of this course is how much it is able to cover. The seminars, workshops, and lectures were all so interesting and informative. You get a lot of individualized feedback from exceptional professors. This is a great class!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES YES YES! One of the best classes I've taken at Yale for sure! I'm a STEM major, so I was a bit hesitant to take the class. But 100% take it!! You become such a better writer and you really learn how to write a story, poems, and a play. You can literally feel yourself improving with each exercise and unit, so it is a very rewarding class. All the stories are also so interesting, so it doesn't feel like work at all.
Yes I would! Derek is great and has incredible advice and concrete tips to strengthen your writing. Please take it!
Yes, this class was so therapeutic and never too much work. All you do is write and read and discuss all things creative writing! A definite must-take class, no matter your major!
Yes!! This course has been one of my favorites that I have ever taken and it was super fun!

I would highly recommend this course to another student. The beauty of ENGL 123 is that it allows you to try your hand in multiple genres, and it really lets you discover what kind of writing you enjoy the most. You might go into the course because of the fiction unit, and come out learning that you want to be a playwright. I also really enjoyed the workshop aspect of the course, and the feedback I received from my peers was great.
Absolutely, especially with Professor Green. It is well worth the time spent, not to hard to make your schedule unbearable, and really grows your writing skills.
YES! You will love creative writing after this class! I didn't realize how much I would love poetry and drama!
I would absolutely recommend this course to another student who is interested in the creative writing path.
Yes, definitely!
Yes! This course is phenomenal. You do a lot of writing in a short amount of time but by the end, you have a final portfolio you can be proud of and a lot of feedback on your writing.
